poem:
**Changing Hands**

In the quiet shuffle  
of ancient letters—  
a new hand grips  
the weight of centuries.  
  
Křetínský's touch,  
a foreign breeze,  
ruffles through  
the Royal Mail's  
sable pages.  
  
Nations fold  
into envelopes,  
sealed with  
the press  
of a distant palm—  
  
history's ink.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Royal Mail takeover by Czech billionaire Daniel Křetínský approved The sale of Royal Mail’s parent company to the Czech billionaire Daniel Křetínský has been approved by the UK government after a review under national security laws. A £3.6bn takeover of International Distribution Services (IDS) – the owner of the 508-year-old Royal Mail – by Křetínský’s EP Group was confirmed on Monday morning.
